1.mnemonic: Words of defense to brothers and fathers

2.mnemonic: In Hebrew speech he quiets the crowd

3.mnemonic: Trained under Gamaliel, truly zealous for law

4.mnemonic: No mercy shown as he persecuted the Way

5.mnemonic: Endorsed by priests with letters to Damascus

6.mnemonic: Suddenly a bright light surrounds him at noon

7.mnemonic: Struck to the ground by a heavenly voice

8.mnemonic: Identifies Himself as Jesus of Nazareth

9.mnemonic: Near companions see light but miss the voice

10.mnemonic: Guided to Damascus to learn God's will

11.mnemonic: Blinded by glory he is led by hand

12.mnemonic: Esteemed Jew Ananias comes and stands beside him

13.mnemonic: From God he receives sight and calling

14.mnemonic: Ordered to know His will and see the Righteous One

15.mnemonic: Raised up as witness of what he saw and heard

16.mnemonic: Exhorted to arise be baptized and washed

17.mnemonic: Temple vision later falls on him in Jerusalem

18.mnemonic: Hastened away by word that they will not receive him

19.mnemonic: Explains his former violence against believers

20.mnemonic: Taking part when Stephen's blood was shed

21.mnemonic: Entrusted now to be sent far to Gentiles

22.mnemonic: Mention of Gentiles enrages the listening crowd

23.mnemonic: People shout he is not fit to live

24.mnemonic: Led into the barracks for scourging examination

25.mnemonic: Exposes his Roman citizenship before the centurion

26.mnemonic: Commander grows concerned that he is a Roman

27.mnemonic: Reminds him that Paul is freeborn

28.mnemonic: On hearing this the examiners withdraw in fear

29.mnemonic: Worried commander releases his bonds the next day

30.mnemonic: Delivered before the council to learn the charge

23.mnemonic: IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT PAUL IS ESCORTED

2.mnemonic: New insult strikes him on the mouth

3.mnemonic: Then Paul rebukes the whitewashed wall

4.mnemonic: Humbles himself when he learns high priest

5.mnemonic: Explains he did not recognize him

7.mnemonic: Insists on resurrection of the dead

8.mnemonic: Dispute erupts between Sadducees and Pharisees

10.mnemonic: Lysias rescues Paul from their violence

11.mnemonic: Encouraged that night by the Lord

12.mnemonic: Oath taken by Jews to kill Paul

14.mnemonic: They inform chief priests of curse

15.mnemonic: Have council ask captain to bring him

20.mnemonic: Hear the plot to kill tomorrow

21.mnemonic: They lie in wait with oath

23.mnemonic: Army of two hundred soldiers prepared

30.mnemonic: Conspiracy known so sent to thee

1.mnemonic: Then high priest Ananias arrives with elders and lawyer

2.mnemonic: Requested by Felix, Tertullus begins accusation

3.mnemonic: In flattery he praises Felix for peace and reforms

4.mnemonic: Appeals for a brief hearing of their case

5.mnemonic: Labels Paul a plague stirring riots among Jews

6.mnemonic: Blames him for profaning the temple before they seized him

7.mnemonic: Extracted from them by commander Lysias, they complain

8.mnemonic: From your examination you can verify these accusations

9.mnemonic: Others, the Jews, join in affirming the charges

10.mnemonic: Responding, Paul gladly offers his defense before Felix

11.mnemonic: Easily they can verify he came to worship twelve days ago

12.mnemonic: They never saw him disputing or stirring up a crowd

13.mnemonic: Hence they cannot prove the things they accuse him of

14.mnemonic: Emphatically he confesses he worships God in the Way

15.mnemonic: Grounded in hope of resurrection of just and unjust

16.mnemonic: Ongoing aim is to keep a clear conscience before God and men

17.mnemonic: Visited Jerusalem to bring alms and offerings to his nation

18.mnemonic: Entered the temple purified, without crowd or disturbance

19.mnemonic: Required witnesses from Asia are not present to accuse

20.mnemonic: None here can state what wrongdoing they found in him

21.mnemonic: Only his cry about resurrection is reason for this trial

22.mnemonic: Resolving to wait for Lysias, Felix adjourns the hearing

23.mnemonic: Freedom under guard is granted, with friends allowed to serve him

24.mnemonic: Entering later with Drusilla, Felix hears of faith in Christ

25.mnemonic: Listening on righteousness, self-control, judgment he becomes afraid

26.mnemonic: Intending to gain money, he often summons Paul to talk

27.mnemonic: Xenial favor to Jews leads Felix to leave Paul imprisoned

1.mnemonic: New governor Festus arrives in province

2.mnemonic: Early he travels from Caesarea up to Jerusalem

3.mnemonic: Whole Jewish leadership states its case against Paul

4.mnemonic: Grant us a favor they ask planning an ambush

5.mnemonic: Objects that Paul must stay guarded in Caesarea

6.mnemonic: Visits there soon and summons Jewish accusers down

7.mnemonic: Entering the tribunal Festus has Paul brought in

8.mnemonic: Raging Jews hurl many serious yet unproved charges

9.mnemonic: Not guilty Paul claims to law temple or Caesar

10.mnemonic: Offering to please Jews Festus asks about Jerusalem trial

11.mnemonic: Refuses; Paul insists on Caesar's court alone

12.mnemonic: Holding to his appeal Festus consults his council

13.mnemonic: End decision is to send Paul to Caesar

14.mnemonic: After some days Agrippa and Bernice visit Festus

15.mnemonic: Report of Paul's case is laid before the king

16.mnemonic: Says Jerusalem Jews demanded he should not live

17.mnemonic: Proclaims Roman custom requires a fair hearing first

18.mnemonic: At once when they came he convened the court

19.mnemonic: Unexpectedly they raised only religious disputes about Jesus

20.mnemonic: Living again is what Paul keeps asserting

21.mnemonic: Still perplexed he had asked about Jerusalem judgment

22.mnemonic: Appeal to the emperor means Paul remains in custody

23.mnemonic: Pleased, Agrippa says he also wants to hear Paul

24.mnemonic: Procession with great pomp brings Agrippa and Bernice

25.mnemonic: Emphasizing Jewish outcry Festus explains the prisoner's case

26.mnemonic: Admits he finds nothing worthy of death yet must send him

27.mnemonic: Lacking clear charges he hopes Agrippa will help him write

1.mnemonic: Extended hand, Paul begins his defense

2.mnemonic: Xultant, he says he is happy to answer

3.mnemonic: Thorough knowledge of Jewish customs in Agrippa

4.mnemonic: Early life among Jews in Jerusalem recounted

5.mnemonic: Noted as strict Pharisee from the beginning

6.mnemonic: Defending hope of God's promise to the fathers

7.mnemonic: Entire twelve tribes hope to attain this promise

8.mnemonic: Doubt why God raising the dead seems incredible

9.mnemonic: Was once convinced he must oppose Jesus

10.mnemonic: Imprisoned many saints and cast votes against them

11.mnemonic: Tortured believers, forcing blasphemy, persecuting afar

12.mnemonic: Near Damascus he traveled with authority to arrest

13.mnemonic: Extra-bright heavenly light surrounds them at midday

14.mnemonic: Spoken voice asks why Saul persecutes and resists goads

15.mnemonic: Saul hears, I am Jesus whom you are persecuting

16.mnemonic: Bidden to rise as servant and witness of vision

17.mnemonic: Escorted by God, sent to Jews and Gentiles

18.mnemonic: From darkness to light their eyes must be opened

19.mnemonic: Obedient to vision, he preached first in Damascus

20.mnemonic: Repentance and deeds befitting repentance proclaimed everywhere

21.mnemonic: Enraged Jews seized him in the temple to kill

22.mnemonic: Kept alive by God to testify to small and great

23.mnemonic: In line with Moses and prophets that Christ would suffer and rise

24.mnemonic: Noisy interruption as Festus cries Paul is mad

25.mnemonic: Gently Paul insists his words are true and reasonable

26.mnemonic: Agrippa knows these events were not done in a corner

27.mnemonic: Gospel-believing question pressed, Paul says he knows Agrippa believes prophets

28.mnemonic: Reply from Agrippa, Almost you persuade me to be Christian

29.mnemonic: If only all hearers might become as I am except these chains

30.mnemonic: Persons present-the king, governor, Bernice-rise and withdraw

31.mnemonic: Privately they agree he has done nothing worthy of death or bonds

32.mnemonic: Appeal to Caesar alone has kept him from release

27.mnemonic: STRANDED ON MALTA AFTER SHIPWRECK ON THE WAY TO ITALY

1.mnemonic: Sailing for Italy under centurion Julius

2.mnemonic: Taken with other prisoners aboard an Adramyttium ship

3.mnemonic: Reaching Sidon where Julius allows Paul to visit friends

4.mnemonic: Against the wind they pass under the lee of Cyprus

5.mnemonic: Navigating off Cilicia and Pamphylia they arrive at Myra

6.mnemonic: Directed onto an Alexandrian grain ship bound for Italy

7.mnemonic: Enduring many slow days they scarcely reach Cnidus

8.mnemonic: Driven along under Crete they come with difficulty to Fair Havens

9.mnemonic: Over time sailing becomes dangerous since the Fast is already past

10.mnemonic: Now Paul warns of impending damage and great loss

11.mnemonic: Master and shipowner persuade the centurion instead of Paul

12.mnemonic: Agreed that they should try to reach Phoenix to winter there

13.mnemonic: Light south wind convinces them to sail close along Crete

14.mnemonic: Tempestuous northeaster suddenly rushes down from the island

15.mnemonic: All control lost they let the ship be driven before the gale

16.mnemonic: Around the little island Cauda they barely secure the lifeboat

17.mnemonic: Fastening cables under the hull they fear running aground on Syrtis

18.mnemonic: Tossed violently they lower the gear and are driven along

19.mnemonic: Exhausted, they throw the ship's tackle overboard with their hands

20.mnemonic: Repeated days without sun or stars rob them of hope of rescue

21.mnemonic: Starving for long, they hear Paul say they should have listened

22.mnemonic: However he now urges courage for no life will be lost

23.mnemonic: In the night an angel of the God he serves stands beside him

24.mnemonic: Promised that he must stand before Caesar and all with him be spared

25.mnemonic: With firm faith he declares it will happen just as God told him

26.mnemonic: Required still is that they run aground on some island

27.mnemonic: Exactly fourteen nights later sailors sense land as they are driven

28.mnemonic: Casting the lead they find the water growing shallower

29.mnemonic: Keenly afraid of reefs they drop four anchors and pray for day

30.mnemonic: Operating deceitfully sailors lower the boat pretending to set anchors

31.mnemonic: Not saved unless these men stay in the ship Paul warns the centurion

32.mnemonic: Then soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat and let it fall

33.mnemonic: Hungry crew are urged by Paul to take food for their survival

34.mnemonic: Encouraging them he says not a hair from any head will perish

35.mnemonic: With thanks to God he breaks bread and begins to eat

36.mnemonic: All become encouraged and themselves also take food

37.mnemonic: Yielding the count they number in all two hundred seventy six souls

38.mnemonic: Then when filled they lighten the ship by throwing wheat into the sea

39.mnemonic: On daybreak they do not recognize the land but notice a bay with a beach

40.mnemonic: Intending if possible they plan to run the ship ashore there

41.mnemonic: Though they loose anchors and rudders and hoist foresail, they strike a sandbar

42.mnemonic: All at once the bow sticks fast while the stern is broken by surf

43.mnemonic: Looking to prevent escape the soldiers plan to kill the prisoners

44.mnemonic: Yet wanting to spare Paul the centurion stops them and all reach land safely on boards and pieces of ship

28.mnemonic: SICK HEALED AND PAUL PREACHES IN ROME

1.mnemonic: Shipwreck survivors learn the island is Malta

2.mnemonic: Islanders show unusual kindness and light a fire

3.mnemonic: Collecting sticks Paul is bitten by a viper

4.mnemonic: Knowing justice they expect him to die

5.mnemonic: He simply shakes the snake into the fire

6.mnemonic: Expecting swelling they watch but see no harm

7.mnemonic: At the estate of Publius they are welcomed

8.mnemonic: Laid-up father of Publius is healed by Paul

9.mnemonic: Everyone sick on the island comes and is cured

10.mnemonic: Departing they receive many honors and supplies

11.mnemonic: Alexandrian ship with Twin Gods carries them on

12.mnemonic: Navigating to Syracuse they stay three days

13.mnemonic: Driven by fair south wind they reach Rhegium then Puteoli

14.mnemonic: Paul finds brothers and stays with them seven days

15.mnemonic: At the Forum of Appius and Three Taverns friends meet him

16.mnemonic: Under guard Paul is allowed to live by himself in Rome

17.mnemonic: Leaders of the Jews are summoned after three days

18.mnemonic: Paul explains charges and his hope in Israel's promise

19.mnemonic: Reports from Judea about him have not been received

20.mnemonic: Eager to hear, they arrange a day to listen fully

21.mnemonic: All day he argues from Law and Prophets about Jesus

22.mnemonic: Conflicting responses arise; some believe and some refuse

23.mnemonic: Hard-hearted text from Isaiah is quoted about dull hearing

24.mnemonic: Ending his message he declares God's salvation is sent to Gentiles

25.mnemonic: Spoken word concludes that they will listen

26.mnemonic: In his own rented house he stays two full years

27.mnemonic: No one forbidding him he preaches the kingdom of God

28.mnemonic: Rome hears the things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ

30.mnemonic: Mission accomplished Paul teaches with all confidence

31.mnemonic: End of the book of Acts
